element.name: Void
element.documentation: Used to void damaged data, to avoid unexpected behaviors when using damaged data. The content is discarded. Also used to reserve space in a sub-element for later use.

element.name: CRC-32
element.documentation: The CRC is computed on all the data of the Master element it's in. The CRC element should be the first in it's parent master for easier reading. All level 1 elements should include a CRC-32. The CRC in use is the IEEE CRC32 Little Endian.

element.name: EBML
element.documentation: Set the EBML characteristics of the data to follow. Each EBML document has to start with this.

element.name: EBMLVersion
element.documentation: The version of EBML parser used to create the file.

element.name: EBMLReadVersion
element.documentation: The minimum EBML version a parser has to support to read this file.

element.name: EBMLMaxIDLength
element.documentation: The maximum length of the IDs you'll find in this file (4 or less in Matroska).

element.name: EBMLMaxSizeLength
element.documentation: The maximum length of the sizes you'll find in this file (8 or less in Matroska). This does not override the element size indicated at the beginning of an element. Elements that have an indicated size which is larger than what is allowed by EBMLMaxSizeLength shall be considered invalid.

element.name: DocType
element.documentation: A string that describes the type of document that follows this EBML header. 'matroska' in our case or 'webm' for webm files.

element.name: DocTypeVersion
element.documentation: The version of DocType interpreter used to create the file.

element.name: DocTypeReadVersion
element.documentation: The minimum DocType version an interpreter has to support to read this file.

element.name: SignatureSlot
element.documentation: Contain signature of some (coming) elements in the stream.

element.name: SignaturePublicKey
element.documentation: The public key to use with the algorithm (in the case of a PKI-based signature).

element.name: Signature
element.documentation: The signature of the data (until a new.

element.name: SignatureElements
element.documentation: Contains elements that will be used to compute the signature.

element.name: SignatureElementList
element.documentation: A list consists of a number of consecutive elements that represent one case where data is used in signature. Ex: Cluster|Block|BlockAdditional means that the BlockAdditional of all Blocks in all Clusters is used for encryption.

element.name: SignedElement
element.documentation: An element ID whose data will be used to compute the signature.
